text: cool but seems impractical during winter months no? stairs getting slippery and all
not just aesthetics though - urban design's gotta prioritize function too!
charm's got its own kind of value – some spots worth their inefficiency 😉
old arcade now an organic food store... times change 😌
gaming cafes taking over old bookstores here
cool street art won't cut traffic hours though
complete myth tbh just need some balancing
need more than just juggling - think mindset shifts too
myths are fun but science wins every time
karabasan tales here never fail at giving chills
people evolve but chilli isn't everyone's endgame lol
stability? more like predictability... gotta keep things fresh!
comfy homes are chill but gotta stay spontaneous!
always plan ahead now guess i'm a 'proper' adult lol
even meal prepping saves heaps now...didn't see that comin' tbh
cancelled subscriptions before free trial ended - small yet savvy save!
cultural molds outdated; forge your own path 👊
life ain't a checklist – everyone’s timeline differs big time
kinda sad when real talk takes a backseat cause 'success' shows up - priorities shift & suddenly old jokes don't land 🤷‍♂️

noticed even solid mates get weirdly competitive instead of happy for ya - like everyone’s life turned into some race nobody agreed running 🏃‍♂️💨 kinda missed memo when chill hangouts became leaderboard checks...
money changes people or just exposes them?
success could just skew your own lens too
meal prep helps - lentils are your friend!
def felt those budget strains lately
meal prepping's been saving tons lately!
hard choices but adapting's spawned some unexpected silver linings tbh
marketing here - stuck close to home base after studying it but totally see how different paths can be equally rewarding!
studied marketing too - now navigating ads & campaigns daily 🎯
it's tons of choice & interest over pure chance tbh
market skills could be clutch - trading's always gonna be key!
don’t underestimate communication skills - crucial even post-collapse!

lol having flashbacks from all those group projects during uni...but real talk - being able to market anything you find as 'must-have' could make you kingpin when everyone's scrounging around 😂 gotta say though brainstorming catchy slogans ain’t much help if can't grow food or start fires straight up
marketing seemed straightfoward after uni but real life taught me quick - plans change & gotta roll with it
marketing major here - surprising detours but no regrets!
expected steady campaigns - constantly adapting strategies instead

marketing kinda seeps into your brain - like you can't help but analyze ad strategies while watching tv... even start internally critiquing copy on cereal boxes at breakfast! it's that one course turning every glance to audience targeting 😂
spotting trends even at friends' birthday parties now!
spotting market trends even when just meme surfing lol
lol analyzing ads becomes second nature at malls & insta
presentation once saved by sticky notes! 👍
once fixed a pitch deck bug mid-meeting with just quick alt-tab magic – clients none wiser!

always thought selling stuff was just hawking goods but honestly it teaches you loads about human behavior - like people often buy into a story way more than just an item itself 👀 making connections through those stories changes your own narrative too
honestly work makes me question every ad i see now - always trying to crack what's behind that catchy slogan or flashy visual...sorta ruins the magic but hey it keeps things real
pivot from spreadsheets to storytelling changed everything - even Netflix tastes evolved!
definitely didn’t expect so many spreadsheets when i started 🙃
team diversity rocks but old habits die hard!
def seen more balance lately - even clients want diversity now!
it's got its quirks for everyone honestly - like a big social media algorithm except you're trying find someone who digs your favorite kebap place too
it's all marketing - profile pic & bio make it or break it 👀
got pushed towards marketing - "better fit" apparently, didn't buy it
seen similar trends in marketing too but leadership roles? kinda rare
yeah def notice shifts at work too, even clients expect diverse teams now which signals change beyond just job ads or any single field

noticed even in marketing there's more balance these days - was used to seeing certain types skew one way but now getting pitches across all boards that's defying old norms. pretty refreshing change tbh!
oh man, don't even get me started on folks suddenly turning into investment gurus over night right when you hit 30! like as if i haven’t been budgeting every single lira until now...
real talk - it gets real deep when you plan a life together
multicultural vibes don't always mean broader minds though
market vibes overrated - city hustle teaches more
balance matters - diversity + pace shape us
small town charm can hit you weird when all you've known are crazy-busy streets - kind of flips your view upside down because those quiet spots don't match up with fast city life back home at all
overcrowded? ever seen kilyos mid-summer? nightmare fuel!
